thread.title: Lt. Gov. says ‘bathroom bill’ not necessary
thread.title_full: Lt. Gov. says ‘bathroom bill’ not necessary

author: Eric Snyder
title: Lt. Gov. says ‘bathroom bill’ not necessary

organizations.name: nashville business journal share eric snyder

text: Lt. Gov. says ‘bathroom bill’ not necessary Feb 24, 2017, 7:50am CST Industries & Tags Eric Snyder Managing Editor Nashville Business Journal Share Eric Snyder Managing Editor Nashville Business Journal Related Content Enlarge Image provided by Getty Images (ninode) Tennessee Lt. Gov. Randy McNally says there is no need for the controversial “bathroom bill” being pursued by Sen. Mae Beavers and Rep. Mark Pody . President Dona’d Trump’s administration this week repealed guidance requiring schools to let transgender students use the bathroom of their choice. The Tennessee bill, opposed by Gov. Bill Haslam and business groups, would require students to use the bathroom consistent with the gender listed on their birth certificate. Enlarge Image provided by Getty Images (ninode) "I think given what the Trump administration’s done, my assessment would be it’s not needed,” McNally said. Beavers, however, said Thursday she plans to move forward with the bill. Related Content
